title: Manchester United 'chasing Declan Rice and Kalidou Koulibaly'
text:
Manchester United are ready to overhaul their squad with big-money moves for Declan Rice and Kalidou Koulibaly, according to Goal.

Even with question marks over the long-term future of manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer, United are seemingly making plans for the January window in a bid to salvage what is quickly becoming a nightmare campaign.

Solskjaer is under mounting pressure following United's worst start for 30 years and the club sat 12th in the Premier League after eight matches.

Man United are ready to push for deals for Declan Rice (left) and Kalidou Koulibaly (right)

Reports say that the duo are targets even if Ole Gunnar Solskjaer is not manager long-term

Rice has established himself for club and country and would solve United's woes in defensive midfield given the struggles of Nemanja Matic and Fred since his £52m arrival from Shakhtar Donetsk.

Rice has become a prized asset for the Hammers and would not depart the London Stadium cheaply given he is under contract until 2024.

A figure of close to £100m has been rumoured with West Ham under no pressure to sell the 21-year-old.

United are enduring their worst start in 30 years and are 12th in the table after a poor run

Solskjaer paid a record fee for a defender to get centre back Harry Maguire for £80m in the summer but a move for Koulibaly is still reported, with United in need of depth in that position given a faltering start.

The Senegalese defender has long been linked with a switch to the Premier League, but has stayed loyal to Napoli.

Jose Mourinho tracked his progress in Serie A but a move never materialised given United were swollen at centre back with Marcos Rojo, Chris Smalling, Phil Jones, Eric Bailly and Victor Lindelof as the options for two spots.

Jones has dropped out of the side under Solskjaer, Bailly is out with a long-term injury and Smalling is spending the season on loan at AS Roma.

In a bid to salvage a top four, or even top six finish, United are widely expected to make signings in January with Christian Eriksen and Mario Mandzukic two other players linked with mid-season switches to Old Trafford.

United's season could take another disappointing turn after the international break when Solskjaer's beleaguered side face high-flying Liverpool.
description: Even with question marks over the long-term future of manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer, United are seemingly making plans for the January window with eyes on Declan Rice and Kalidou Koulibaly.
